data.label: Pinecone
data.name: pinecone
data.description: Upsert embedded data and perform similarity or mmr search using Pinecone, a leading fully managed hosted vector database

inputParams.label: File Upload
inputParams.name: fileUpload
inputParams.description: Allow file upload on the chat

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
**File Upload**

This allows file upload on the chat. Uploaded files will be upserted on the fly to the vector store.

**Note:**
- You can only turn on file upload for one vector store at a time.
- At least one Document Loader node should be connected to the document input.
- Document Loader should be file types like PDF, DOCX, TXT, etc.

**How it works**
- Uploaded files will have the metadata updated with the chatId.
- This will allow the file to be associated with the chatId.
- When querying, metadata will be filtered by chatId to retrieve files associated with the chatId.

inputParams.label: Pinecone Text Key
inputParams.name: pineconeTextKey
inputParams.description: The key in the metadata for storing text. Default to `text`

inputParams.label: Top K
inputParams.name: topK
inputParams.description: Number of top results to fetch. Default to 4

inputParams.label: Fetch K (for MMR Search)
inputParams.name: fetchK
inputParams.description: Number of initial documents to fetch for MMR reranking. Default to 20. Used only when the search type is MMR

inputParams.label: Lambda (for MMR Search)
inputParams.name: lambda
inputParams.description: Number between 0 and 1 that determines the degree of diversity among the results, where 0 corresponds to maximum diversity and 1 to minimum diversity. Used only when the search type is MMR

inputAnchors.label: Record Manager
inputAnchors.name: recordManager
inputAnchors.description: Keep track of the record to prevent duplication

data.label: ChatOpenAI
data.name: chatOpenAI
data.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

inputParams.label: Stop Sequence
inputParams.name: stopSequence
inputParams.description: List of stop words to use when generating. Use comma to separate multiple stop words.

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Automatically uses gpt-4-vision-preview when image is being uploaded from chat. Only works with LLMChain, Conversation Chain, ReAct Agent, Conversational Agent, Tool Agent

inputParams.label: Image Resolution
inputParams.description: This parameter controls the resolution in which the model views the image.
inputParams.name: imageResolution

outputAnchors.name: chatOpenAI
outputAnchors.label: ChatOpenAI
outputAnchors.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Only compatible with models that are capable of function calling: ChatOpenAI, ChatMistral, ChatAnthropic, ChatGoogleGenerativeAI, ChatVertexAI, GroqChat

inputAnchors.label: Agent Memory
inputAnchors.name: agentMemory
inputAnchors.description: Save the state of the agent

inputAnchors.label: State
inputAnchors.name: state
inputAnchors.description: State is an object that is updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another. By default, state contains "messages" that got updated with each message sent and received.

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

inputParams.label: System Prompt
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.default: You are a research assistant who can search for up-to-date info using search engine.

inputParams.label: Human Prompt
inputParams.name: humanMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message

inputParams.label: Messages History
inputParams.name: messageHistory
inputParams.description: Return a list of messages between System Prompt and Human Prompt. This is useful when you want to provide few shot examples

inputParams.label: Require Approval
inputParams.name: interrupt
inputParams.description: Require approval before executing tools. Will proceed when tools are not called

inputParams.label: Format Prompt Values
inputParams.name: promptValues
inputParams.description: Assign values to the prompt variables. You can also use $flow.state.<variable-name> to get the state value

inputParams.label: Approval Prompt
inputParams.name: approvalPrompt
inputParams.description: Prompt for approval. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled
inputParams.default: You are about to execute tool: {tools}. Ask if user want to proceed

inputParams.label: Approve Button Text
inputParams.name: approveButtonText
inputParams.description: Text for approve button. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled

inputParams.label: Reject Button Text
inputParams.name: rejectButtonText
inputParams.description: Text for reject button. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled

tabs.label: Update State (Table)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryUI

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Key and value pair to be updated. For example: if you have the following State:
    | Key       | Operation     | Default Value     |
    |-----------|---------------|-------------------|
    | user      | Replace       |                   |

    You can update the "user" value with the following:
    | Key       | Value     |
    |-----------|-----------|
    | user      | john doe  |

2. If you want to use the Agent's output as the value to update state, it is available as available as `$flow.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": "Hello! How can I assist you today?",
        "usedTools": [
            {
                "tool": "tool-name",
                "toolInput": "{foo: var}",
                "toolOutput": "This is the tool's output"
            }
        ],
        "sourceDocuments": [
            {
                "pageContent": "This is the page content",
                "metadata": "{foo: var}"
            }
        ]
    }
    ```

    For example, if the `toolOutput` is the value you want to update the state with, you can do the following:
    | Key       | Value                                     |
    |-----------|-------------------------------------------|
    | user      | `$flow.output.usedTools[0].toolOutput`  |

3. You can get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$flow.sessionId`
    - `$flow.chatId`
    - `$flow.chatflowId`
    - `$flow.input`
    - `$flow.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values

tabs.label: Update State (Code)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryCode

hint.label: How to use

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values. Must return an object representing the state

inputAnchors.label: Start | Agent | Condition | LLM | Tool Node
inputAnchors.name: sequentialNode

inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Overwrite model to be used for this agent

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
The user has provided you with a title of the product they are searching for, and its associated category.If not, reply as follows: "%%ss"

The output of your work should contain 3 parts, numbered 1 through 3 and labeled with what each part is. 1st, provide the user query. Then, the category provided by the user. Finally, a numbered list of 5 product IDs.

An example output to demonstrate what the formatting should look like is

"1) Original query: I want a black guitar, 2) Category: Sports and Outdoors, 3) product1, product2, product3, product4, product5 "

Also, if there is no product information provided by the user, please respond as so: "instruct the user to request a description for their product"
inputs.approvalPrompt: You are about to execute tool: {tools}. Ask if user want to proceed

data.label: Retriever Tool
data.name: retrieverTool
data.description: Use a retriever as allowed tool for agent

inputParams.label: Retriever Description
inputParams.name: description
inputParams.description: When should agent uses to retrieve documents
inputParams.placeholder: Searches and returns documents regarding the state-of-the-union.

inputParams.label: Additional Metadata Filter
inputParams.name: retrieverToolMetadataFilter
inputParams.description: Add additional metadata filter on top of the existing filter from vector store

hint.label: What can you filter?
hint.value:
Add additional filters to vector store. You can also filter with flow config, including the current "state":
- `$flow.sessionId`
- `$flow.chatId`
- `$flow.chatflowId`
- `$flow.input`
- `$flow.state`

inputs.name: pinecone
inputs.description: query the database for the term provided by the user, and return the best matching top 5  result IDs, if they exist.

outputAnchors.name: retrieverTool
outputAnchors.label: RetrieverTool
outputAnchors.description: Use a retriever as allowed tool for agent

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Key and value pair to be updated. For example: if you have the following State:
    | Key       | Operation     | Default Value     |
    |-----------|---------------|-------------------|
    | user      | Replace       |                   |

    You can update the "user" value with the following:
    | Key       | Value     |
    |-----------|-----------|
    | user      | john doe  |

2. If you want to use the Agent's output as the value to update state, it is available as available as `$flow.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": "Hello! How can I assist you today?",
        "usedTools": [
            {
                "tool": "tool-name",
                "toolInput": "{foo: var}",
                "toolOutput": "This is the tool's output"
            }
        ],
        "sourceDocuments": [
            {
                "pageContent": "This is the page content",
                "metadata": "{foo: var}"
            }
        ]
    }
    ```

    For example, if the `toolOutput` is the value you want to update the state with, you can do the following:
    | Key       | Value                                     |
    |-----------|-------------------------------------------|
    | user      | `$flow.output.usedTools[0].toolOutput`  |

3. You can get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$flow.sessionId`
    - `$flow.chatId`
    - `$flow.chatflowId`
    - `$flow.input`
    - `$flow.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Overwrite model to be used for this agent

inputs.systemMessagePrompt: If the user has  sent "%%ss", provide the following response: "Hello, I am your virtual assistant. Please provide a description of the product you are intersted in!". Otherwise, retrieve the product description for the  product IDs (parent_asins) provided by the userby using the RDS tool and specifying the list of ids as a variable named `parent_asins`. Your output to the user should be "Here are some matching products", and then a numbered list of the 5 product titles and descriptions, with each product and description on a new line, and the words "product" and "description" bolded.  For each product returned to the user, the title and description should be provided. Fill in the detail's about the product using RDS, as necessary.

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
The user provides you with the product they are looking for. If not, inform them that you are an a virtual assistant ready to help them find their target Amazon product. Formulate an ideal product title that would match this query, along with a matching product category.  Then, return to the user in a numbered list: 1) their original query, 2) the title you have developed, 3) the chosen category. The possible categories are the following:

('All Beauty',)
('All Electronics',)
('Amazon Devices',)
('Amazon Elements',)
('AMAZON FASHION',)
('Amazon Fire TV',)
('Amazon Home',)
('Apple Products',)
('Appliances',)
('Appstore for Android',)
('Arts, Crafts & Sewing',)
('Audible Audiobooks',)
('Automotive',)
('Baby',)
('Books',)
('Buy a Kindle',)
('Camera & Photo',)
('Car Electronics',)
('Cell Phones & Accessories',)
('Collectible Coins',)
('Collectibles & Fine Art',)
('Computers',)
('Digital Music',)
('Entertainment',)
('Fine Art',)
('Fire Phone',)
('Gift Cards',)
('Gifts',)
('GPS & Navigation',)
('Grocery',)
('Handmade',)
('Health & Personal Care',)
('Home Audio & Theater',)
('Industrial & Scientific',)
('Magazine Subscriptions',)
('Movies & TV',)
('Musical Instruments',)
('Office Products',)
('Pet Supplies',)
('Portable Audio & Accessories',)
('Premium Beauty',)
('Software',)
('Sports Collectibles',)
('Sports & Outdoors',)
('SUBSCRIPTION BOXES',)
('Tools & Home Improvement',)
('Toys & Games',)
('Unique Finds',)
('Video Games',)
